result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan F Salinas Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Comply with any child support ordered. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including anger management.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

records.addlTxt:
2:41 PM Defendant Juan F Salinas Sr in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove in court for Juan F Salinas Sr.  Attorney Jessica Lynott in court for State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Upon plea to Ct. 1 and 2 in 22CF375 and the State recommend consecutive prison in Ct. 1 and the length left to the court, On Ct. 2 the State would recommend concurrent time, length left to the court.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  CC used as a factual basis.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.  State is in Chapter 950 compliance.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defense is asking for consecutive probation.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf. 
Plea:
22CF375:
Ct. 1- NC
Ct. 2- NC

BTC: 
22CF375:
Ct. 1- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1 yr. ES.  Consecutive to current sentence. 
Ct. 2- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1 yr. ES.  Concurrent to Ct. 1.  Consecutive to current sentence.  
Not eligible for CIP.  Eligible for SAP.  
22CF183:
Ct. 1- DRI
Ct. 2- DRI

Conditions:
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent, to include anger management. .  
Obtain and maintain full time employment. 
Comply with any child support ordered. 
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.
FAW/Vote.
